title: Understand the Work Formula
text: The work done on a gas during compression can be calculated using the formula: W $$=$$ -P_{ext} * ΔV, where P_{ext} is the constant external pressure and ΔV is the change in volume.

title: Calculate Change in Volume
text: Find the change in volume ΔV by subtracting the final volume from the initial volume: ΔV $$=$$ V_{final} - V_{initial}.

title: Convert Pressure-Volume Work to Joules
text: Remember to convert the work from L·atm to Joules using the conversion factor: $$1$$ L·atm $$=$$ $$101.3$$ J.

title: Calculate the Work Done in L·atm
text: Use the work formula W $$=$$ -P_{ext} * ΔV \) to find the work done in L·atm.

title: Convert Work to Joules
text: Convert the calculated work from L·atm to Joules: W(J) $$=$$ W(L · atm) * $$101.3$$.
